name: carburation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of mixing fuel and air to produce the gas that is burned to provide power for operating a vehicle or machine: His high-speed motor led to the development of the process of carburation to utilize liquid fuels. In terms of carburation, the vehicle must meet emissions rules. The carburettor mixes the fuel with air by carburetion.
More examplesFewer examplesCarburation is the process by which air and fuel vapour are mixed in the correct proportions. A few carburation modifications were indicated to help reduce emissions even further. When you drive above 60 miles per hour, the carburetion system in most cars is less efficient.
